97f98e5df342.description: Perspectives of a 2x entrepreneur turned VC at @UpfrontVC, the largest and most active early-stage fund in Southern California. Snapchat: msuster
97f98e5df342.name: Both Sides of the Table
97f98e5df342.shortDescription: Perspectives of a 2x entrepreneur turned VC at @UpfrontVC…

paragraphs.text: Fundamentally the system feels broken. We educate and train and test for a set of skills designed to succeed in 1950.
paragraphs.name: a26e

paragraphs.text: Building any business is hard, all-consuming, frustrating and fraught with personal challenges. When a founder is “opportunity driven” it’s too easy to quit at the first bump in the road. When a founder is “mission driven” you get the sense that he or she will do whatever it takes to make an impact in the market they serve and will keep persevering whatever the startup trends of the month.
paragraphs.name: 8fae

paragraphs.text: But we of course now live in a “knowledge economy” that has to constantly adapt to changing market conditions. As leaders we intuitively know that while basic skills in math, science, reading & writing are necessary — they are not sufficient.

paragraphs.name: 8fae
paragraphs.text: Building any business is hard, all-consuming, frustrating and fraught with personal challenges. When a founder is “opportunity driven” it’s too easy to quit at the first bump in the road. When a founder is “mission driven” you get the sense that he or she will do whatever it takes to make an impact in the market they serve and will keep persevering whatever the startup trends of the month.

paragraphs.name: e970
paragraphs.text: I encourage entrepreneurs to try and tackle harder problems even if it makes fund raising more difficult and is less likely to succeed. As entrepreneurs many people are driven to solve their personal issues right in front of them, which leads a disproportionate number of founders to focus on: music, bars, restaurants, photos, etc.
Great article. Thanks for sharing.

1ec40d7eb87a.title: Our aim is to lend to financially less previledged.

paragraphs.text: Our aim is to lend to financially less previledged. This is a private financing firm that lends to both private individuals and companies. Our lending rate is 3%. All kinds of loan such as mortgage, home equity, debt consolidation, construction, personal, business (startups and expansion), students and auto loan are available here. Visit us at…

paragraphs.text: Even if the stuff they do makes no sense to others. When you are “mission driven” you will take risks and be a bold entrepreneur.

paragraphs.text: A platitude I think describes the failure of our current system well: “When a measure becomes a target it ceases to be a good measure.”
So rad
paragraphs.name: caad

935c477d4ae6.title: This is what the world needs.

paragraphs.text: This is what the world needs. Not just the next google, Facebook or all those. The education system is so broken that the Band-Aids need Band-Aids. I look forward to seeing how Imbellus grows. So great you invested in this.
paragraphs.name: 16c1

paragraphs.text: Super interesting concept. Having worked with vocational education institutions, I have heard this problem from their POV. They want more realistic and useful skills to be shared with student’s in their chosen career. They too have the same rhetoric around the the system of education being broken.

virtuals.subtitle: We need more adaptive learning styles to sustain our future. The social and psychological needs of the younger generation are not being met…

8c13ce5b762e.title: I am happy to see this.

paragraphs.text: I am happy to see this. I hope it spurs other to build and invest in a brave new (scalable) model for childhood education. For others interested, a fascinating deeper dive on the evolution of education can be found in this film “Most Likely to Succeed”. Absolutely worth a screening: http://www.mltsfilm.org/
paragraphs.name: d86d

paragraphs.text: Congrats on the funding Rebecca! I often ask myself if VCs are doing their duty to improve the world thru funding true innovation, what you’re doing is a whole new type of “Frontier Tech” but possibly the most important frontier, we know how we prioritize and measure education is insufficient and yet there are few people truly trying to fix the…

paragraphs.text: “Missionaries not mercenaries” we always say. Thank you for sharing your investment criteria and insights — valuable to any startup raising funds. Across the ocean in Dubai at BECO Capital we feel very much the same way about passionate founders solving hard problems with a differentiated plan! We’ll be following the success of Imbellus closely too :) Thank you for all your contributions to the ecosystem.
paragraphs.name: 1cb1

876034b73a02.title: We educate and train our children with a set of skills designed to pass tests designed in 1950.

paragraphs.text: We educate and train our children with a set of skills designed to pass tests designed in 1950. Does this help some succeed in today’s world? Sure but there is huge wastage and inefficiency and resulting loss to human kind. Time to train for skills of Today’s world.
paragraphs.name: c5a9

514b742de4fa.title: And that those skills can be acquired today by learning and doing projects online, and not…

paragraphs.text: And that those skills can be acquired today by learning and doing projects online, and not necessarily pursuing a Phd
Perfection. Rarely do I see a VC articulate what truly makes world changing businesses the way you do Mark. Bravo.
As a consultant who builds world changing businesses, convincing my clients to go for the big, nebulous stuff and make it clear takes what seems like endless courage and conviction.

638b4ce4a9c7.title: Wonderful to hear, Mark — this is an area I’m also passionate about and I look forward to hearing…

paragraphs.text: Wonderful to hear, Mark — this is an area I’m also passionate about and I look forward to hearing more about Imbellus in the near future — goodness knows we need someone/thing to majorly disrupt mainstream education, because the minds that perpetuate the outdated 19th/20th century thinking that’s currently in control aren’t going to come up it! :-)
paragraphs.name: 722a

paragraphs.text: Mark, thanks for the article.
paragraphs.name: 74f2

paragraphs.text: My question to you is this: given the school’s love affair with standardized testings and rankings based on test scores, are we just dulling ourselves to a system where rote memorization and good test taking skills are king (even with common core being implemented)?
